properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 6 at 4:33AM PST until January 6 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...Snow will continue in the Cascades and Blue Mountains today...

.Pacific moisture continues to overspread the region and bring
snow to the Cascades. Several more inches of snow will fall on
Snoqualmie and White Passes today. Snow accumulations will be in
feet on area mountains. Snow is also expected in the Blue Mtns
where 2 to 10 inches are expected. Breezy winds could lead to
areas of blowing and drifting snow.

* WHAT...Snow above 3500 feet. Snow accumulations of 2 to 10
inches. Highest snow totals will focus on high terrain north of
Oregon Route 204. Conditions will be breezy with gusts in
excess of 40 mph possible on exposed ridges or mountains.

* WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. In Oregon,
Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. This includes Interstate 84
where 1 to 3 inches are expected and Oregon Route 204 where 4
to 7 inches are expected.

* WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult, particularly on Oregon
Route 204. Breezy conditions may lead to blowing or drifting
snow.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting Washington DOT or
Oregon Tripcheck online.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3500 FEET
